ranges.notes: New Year's Day celebrations in Puerta del Sol. Public holiday.
Off-season with fewer tourists and good hotel value. Cold winter climate with daytime temperatures around 10°C.
Three Kings celebration features a spectacular parade through central Madrid and marks the main gift-giving tradition in Spain. January 6 is a public holiday.
Winter sales begin mid-January in all shops and department stores. Museums and cultural venues are less crowded.
Still relatively quiet tourist season with cold winter temperatures. Good time for cultural visits and indoor activities.
Spain's most important contemporary art fair, attracting international galleries and collectors. Held at IFEMA exhibition center.
End of winter season with gradually improving temperatures. Museum visits and indoor cultural activities recommended.
Early spring with gradually warming temperatures. Parks begin to show first signs of spring blooms.
Major design event featuring exhibitions, installations, and events celebrating contemporary design across various venues.
Spring officially begins with warming temperatures and blossoming trees in Retiro Park and other green spaces. Excellent time for outdoor activities and museum visits.
Prime spring conditions with pleasant temperatures ideal for sightseeing and outdoor activities.

ranges.event: Semana Santa (Holy Week - varies by year)
ranges.notes: Madrid's Holy Week processions are solemn and spectacular, featuring elaborate religious floats and traditional music through historic streets. Particularly impressive on Holy Thursday and Good Friday.
Perfect spring weather with warm days and cool evenings. Ideal time to visit before summer crowds arrive. Spring flowers bloom in Retiro Park and other gardens.
Annual literary event held in Retiro Park with hundreds of book stalls, author signings, and literary activities.
Continuing excellent spring conditions with longer days perfect for extended sightseeing and outdoor dining.
Public holiday with events throughout the city. Many locals head to parks for picnics and celebrations.
Madrid's patron saint festival featuring traditional events, concerts, and cultural activities in Pradera de San Isidro park.
Prestigious ATP and WTA tournament featuring world-class players at the Caja Mágica complex.
Excellent time to visit with perfect temperatures. Outdoor dining becomes especially pleasant with all restaurant terraces open. Spring festivals and cultural events throughout the city.
Early summer brings consistent warm weather ideal for outdoor activities and dining. Crowds build gradually but not yet at peak season levels.
Midsummer celebration featuring traditional festivities and cultural events throughout the city.
Summer tourism season begins with longer days and warm evenings perfect for outdoor dining and cultural activities.
Peak summer season begins with hot temperatures. Morning and evening activities recommended to avoid midday heat.
One of Europe's largest LGBTQ+ pride celebrations with parades, concerts, and cultural events centered in Chueca neighborhood.
Summer-long cultural festival featuring open-air concerts, theater performances, and cultural events in various venues across Madrid.
Hot summer weather with many businesses closed for holidays. Many locals leave the city for vacation destinations.
Traditional festival in La Latina neighborhood featuring religious celebrations and cultural events. Public holiday.
Good hotel deals available but some restaurants and shops may be closed. Hot days with warm nights good for evening activities.
Excellent time to visit as summer crowds diminish but weather remains warm. Cultural season begins with new exhibitions and performances.
Spain's premier fashion event featuring runway shows and industry events. Some events open to the public with advance booking.
Perfect temperatures for sightseeing with warm days and pleasant evenings. Full cultural calendar of events as autumn begins.
Excellent autumn weather with warm days perfect for sightseeing. Cultural season in full swing with major exhibitions and performances.
National holiday commemorating Columbus's arrival in the Americas, with military parades and events in central Madrid.
Mild autumn with fewer tourists, excellent time for cultural activities and museum visits. Autumn colors begin to appear in Retiro Park and other green spaces.
Public holiday with traditional cemetery visits and special services. Many businesses closed.
Mild autumn continues with good conditions for city exploration. Lower tourist numbers mean better access to popular attractions.
Major film festival featuring premieres, retrospectives, and special events at various venues throughout the city.
Early winter with cooler temperatures but still pleasant for sightseeing. Preparations for Christmas begin.
Early Christmas preparations with decorations appearing throughout the city.
Public holiday commemorating the Spanish Constitution. Many businesses closed.
'Puente' (bridge) holiday period between Constitution Day and Immaculate Conception.
Public holiday with special religious services. Many businesses closed.
Madrid's spectacular Christmas lights on Gran Vía and other major streets feature synchronized light shows and festive decorations.
Public holiday with limited opening hours. Family celebration day.
Post-Christmas period with continued holiday atmosphere, festive decorations throughout the city, and winter sales beginning.
Celebrations throughout the city, particularly in Puerta del Sol, with the tradition of eating 12 grapes at midnight. Many restaurants offer special New Year's dinners.

spring: Semana Santa Processions in Historic Center
Madrid Open Tennis Tournament at Caja Mágica
Madrid Book Fair in Retiro Park
summer: Veranos de la Villa Cultural Events

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
